Content: Then again, there are projects out there with less working tech than KMD but have much more recognition and investor interests.  Maybe it's time to admit that whatever marketing strategy that have been used is not very effective and something new needs to be tried.

Content: We have governments and international organizations and several high profile funds looking at utilizing the tech .

Author: richardt#2807
Content: ^ now that would be a good marketing point.  Care to share more details? 😄

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: When it’s time to. More important to focus on execution.   Komodo operates with lots of parallel developments hence why we can put out a stream  of development updates.  By every metric our growth continues except coin price and a lot of that has to do with Gresham’s law situation surrounding bitcoin.  And the fact that 99.99999% of people are in it for immediate fiat gains doesn’t help either.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: However I do agree we can expand marketing  efforts

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: We need to hit the pavement more so we need need to build the tools and train the troops to do so

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
`We need to hit the pavement more so we need need to build the tools and train the troops to do so`
This is a thing labs will help with a lot, if it takes off. The idea is to gamify teaching how to build and test the tech while offering ppl financial incentive at the same time. Because 99% of people only want money, we need to make learning about the tech and using it profitable in the short term.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Get enough people.involved and long term profits look after themself

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: For cc development itself, IMO we have a fair way to go before any normal person can make contracts. I've discovered a lot of things making the payments cc that should make cc development much easier in the future.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Contracts can be made without such difficult vout constraints by using a heap of code borrowed from verus, won't be a small job getting some standard working though.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: And also remains backwards compatible with existing shit

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the entire way they work needs to be slightly changed. The ccvout can actually contain its own "OP_RETURN" I got basics of this working already in paymentsCC, but there is a far better way to do it even than that I just need to get my head around and make something that uses it.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
OpenBadges is a Mozilla-backed initiative to make digital forms of certifications or rewards or "merit badges"
KMD might be able to "issue" them directly on a blockchain: https://openbadges.org/developers/

I like this Idea @dukeleto -

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: But it could also be used as a social credit system which is or isn't a bad thing.  I guess that depends on how it's depolyed.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @FishyGuts many educational institutions give out digital "open badges", for say Python coding, and you can show that badge on your website, and others can cryptographically verify that yes, indeed, you do actually have that badge from that organization. It removes the "lying on your resume" part of the game, or at least makes it a lot harder

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's been around for many years and I haven't checked on it lately, but it's well-funded and well-connected. KMD adding a badge to their system would put KMD in front of the eyes of many people that would otherwise never see it

Content: yes, electrums updated to latest version... one still to go... but should not matter, since the IP of the one that is offline is removed from DNS answer, so you should connect normally, with electrum1 to electrum3.cipig.net and it should resolv to a running electrum
